type.description: BGP link state unicast address family route type.

from.description: Source peer that sends a route.

peer-router-id.description: Router ID of source peer that sends a route.

nexthop.description: Next hop address to which packets are forwarded.

local-preference.description: Local priority. The attribute is only fit for the routes from IBGP peer, not suit for which of EBGP peer.

originator.description: Router ID of the route initiator.

med.description: Route MED.The attribute is only fit for the routes from EBGP peer, not suit for which of IBGP peer.

flag-string.description: Route flag that contains a string of characters.

interface-name.description: Name of the outbound interface of a route.

relay-nexthop.description: Next hop to which a route is iterated.

path-as.description: List of the AS_Paths that packets pass through.

worse-reason.description: Reason why a route is not selected.
Reason why a route is not selected.

worse-reason-deprecated.description: Reason why a route is not selected.

worse-reason.description: Reason why a route is not selected. The node is deprecated.

ls-ip-prefix-route-type.description: Link state unicast address family IP prefix route type configuration.

prefix-sid.description: Prefix Sid attribute information of route.

ls-srv6-sid-route-type.description: Link state unicast address family srv6 sid route type configuration.

srv6-sid-structure.description: Length of each individual part of the SRv6 SID.

ls-link-route-type.description: Link state unicast address family link route type configuration.

ipv4-local-node-router-id.description: IPv4 router id of local node.

ipv6-local-node-router-id.description: IPv6 router id of local node.

ipv4-remote-node-router-id.description: IPv4 router id of remote node.

ipv6-remote-node-router-id.description: IPv6 router id of remote node.

srv6-endx-sid.description: END.X SID of an SRv6 route on a P2P network.

srv6-lan-endx-sid.description: END.X SID of an SRv6 route on a LAN network.

link-local-id.description: Local ID of an LS link route.

link-remote-id.description: Remote ID of an LS link route.

ipv4-local-node-router-id.description: IPv4 router id of local node.

ipv6-local-node-router-id.description: IPv6 router id of local node.

ipv4-prefix-route-number.description: Total number of IPv4 prefix routes.

ipv6-prefix-route-number.description: Total number of IPv6 prefix routes.

te-policy-route-number.description: Total number of TE policy routes.

bgp_schema.description:
Inter-AS routing protocol that exchanges Network Layer Reachability Information (NLRI) with other BGP systems,
Universal BGP configurations that contain the basic BGP configurations and the query information.

global.description: Configure the router for BGP globally.

yang-enable.description: Enable/disable BGP yang mode. To use NETCONF YANG to manage BGP VPN instances in huawei-bgp.yang, enable YANG management for the BGP VPN instances on the device or enable the leaf node globally in the huawei-bgp.yang file.

memory-overload-exception-discard-route.description: Enable/disable BGP to discard routes received from all peers if the memory usage of a device is abnormal.

paf-controls.description: List of PAF-based limiting disabled for some features.

paf-control.description: Configure PAF-based limiting disabled for some features.

cir-value.description: Specify the session CAR CIR value.

cbs-value.description: Specify the session CAR CBS value.

pir-value.description: Specify the session CAR PIR value.

pbs-value.description: Specify the session CAR PBS value.

cir-value.description: Specify the micro CAR CIR value.

cbs-value.description: Specify the micro CAR CBS value.

pir-value.description: Specify the micro CAR PIR value.

pbs-value.description: Specify the micro CAR PBS value.

base-process.description: Configure the global BGP information, such as the protocol version, AS number, and system identifier.

as.description:
Local AS number, which can be in either of the two formats:
The two-byte format is X. X is an integer ranging from 1 to 65535.
The four-byte format is X.Y and X. When the format is X.Y, X and Y are both integers, with the value of X ranging from 1 to 65535, and the value of Y ranging from 0 to 65535; when the format is X, X is an interger, with the value ranging from 1 to 4294967295.
An AS consists of multiple routers managed based on the same techniques. Interior Gateway Protocol (IGP) and universal routing metric packets are used inside an AS, and Exterior Gateway Protocol (EGP) is used outside to send packets to other ASs. With the development of this definition, one AS usually uses multiple IGPs and metrics. Even though multiple IGPs and metrics are used, the routing plan and destination reachability of an AS are consistent with those of another AS. The local AS number cannot be configured same as the confederation sub-ASs. The object cannot be deleted or modified.

keep-all-routes.description: Enable/disable saving all the updated information about BGP routes from a peer or peer group after a BGP connection is established, even though these BGP routes fail to match the routing policy on the ingress. Save all the updated information about BGP routes from a peer or peer group after a BGP connection is established, even though these BGP routes fail to match the routing policy on the ingress. By default, only the updated information about BGP routes from a specified peer is saved on condition that the routes match the routing policy on the ingress. If a router supports route refreshing, this option is not required.

check-first-as.description: Enable/disable checking the first AS in the AS_Path of the update messages from EBGP peers.

router-id-auto-select.description:
Enable/disable router ID auto select. If a BGP VPN instance is not enabled to select a router ID, a router ID can be configured for the BGP VPN instance. If no router ID is configured for the BGP VPN instance, the BGP VPN instance inherits the router ID of the public network instance. If a BGP VPN instance is enabled to select a router ID, it uses the address of an interface bound to a VPN as the router ID based on the following rules:
1. If Loopback interfaces configured with IP addresses exist, the largest IP address among the IP addresses of the Loopback interfaces is selected as the router ID.
2. If there is no Loopback interface configured with an IP address, the largest IP address among the IP addresses of other interfaces is selected as the router ID, regardless of whether the interface is Up.

private-4byte-as.description: Enable/disable BGP private 4 byte AS. With BGP private-4-byte-as, BGP private as is from 64512 to 65535 and from 4200000000 to 4294967294.

as-path-limit.description: Maximum number of AS numbers in the AS_Path attribute.

dynamic-session-limit.description: Upper limit on the number of dynamic peer sessions.

peer-up-route-lowest-priority.description: Enable/disable reducing route priority to lowest.

nonstanded.description: Enable/disable nonstanded. Configure the device to be compatible with devices in a nonstandard confederation.

items.description:
Configure the confederation AS number. The confederation AS number can be in either of the two formats:
The two-byte format is X. X is an integer ranging from 1 to 65535.
The four-byte format is X.Y and X. When the format is X.Y, X and Y are both integers, with the value of X ranging from 1 to 65535, and the value of Y ranging from 0 to 65535; when the format is X, X is an interger, with the value of X ranging from 1 to 4294967295. The confederation sub-ASs cannot be configured same as the local AS number.

default-parameter.description: Statistics of default parameter of BGP.

srgbs.description: List of segment routing global block.

lower-bound.description: SRGB begin value. The range of specific values is dynamic and is also affected by paf.

upper-bound.description: SRGB end value. The range of specific values is dynamic and is also affected by paf. The ending value of SRGB must be greater than the configured value.

graceful-restart-status_schema.description: Statistics of the GR status of a BGP speaker.

enable.description: The GR capability of a BGP speaker.

restart-timer.description: Period during which a BGP speaker waits for the peer relationship reestablishment.

eor-timer.description: Period during which a BGP speaker waits for the End-Of-RIB flag.

peers.description: List of display the GR statistics for a BGP peer.

peer.description: Statistics of the GR status of a BGP peer.

vpn-name.description: VPN name of a BGP instance.

peers_schema.description: List of BGP peer error information.

peer.description:
Statistics of BGP peer error information. The display error discard command displays statistics about all address families and packets discarded by peers. The NMS supports query based on the following filtering modes:
(1) Statistics query about the specified address family and statistics about the packets discarded by peers. Such query is not supported by the preceding command.
(2) Query of the information about the discarded packets filtered based on the specified peer or VPN instance. The query result is different from that in the command output. The command displays the statistics of the address family in which packet loss occurs and the information about the packets discarded by the peer.

cluster-id-loop-count.description: Count of routes discarded because cluster IDs are the same.

receive-as-over-limit-count.description: Count of received routes discarded because the number of AS numbers in the AS_Path exceeds the upper limit.

advertise-as-over-limit-count.description: Count of advertised routes discarded because the number of AS numbers in the AS_Path exceeds the upper limit.

as-loop-count.description: Count of routes discarded because AS numbers are the same.

zero-rd-count.description: Count of routes discarded because of the RD 0:0.

no-prefix-count.description: Count of routes discarded because no prefix exists.

path-attribute-error-count.description: Count of routes with error path attributes.

originator-id-loop-count.description: Count of routes with an Originator ID conflict.

afs.description: List of BGP routes discarded in the address family.

af.description: Statistics of BGP route discarded in the address family.

cluster-id-loop-count.description: Count of routes discarded because cluster IDs are the same.

receive-as-over-limit-count.description: Count of received routes discarded because the number of AS numbers in the AS_Path exceeds the upper limit.

instance-processs_schema.description: List of the global BGP information for the list of all BGP instances, such as the protocol version, AS number, and system identifier.

instance-process.description: Configure the global BGP information for the BGP instances, such as the protocol version, AS number, and system identifier.

as-number.description:
Local AS number, which can be in either of the two formats:
The two-byte format is X. X is an integer ranging from 1 to 65535.
The four-byte format is X.Y and X. When the format is X.Y, X and Y are both integers, with the value of X ranging from 1 to 65535, and the value of Y ranging from 0 to 65535; when the format is X, X is an interger, with the value ranging from 1 to 4294967295.
An AS consists of instance routers managed based on the same techniques. Interior Gateway Protocol (IGP) and universal routing metric packets are used inside an AS, and Exterior Gateway Protocol (EGP) is used outside to send packets to other ASs. With the development of this definition, one AS usually uses instance IGPs and metrics. Even though instance IGPs and metrics are used, the routing plan and destination reachability of an AS are consistent with those of another AS. The local AS number cannot be configured same as the confederation sub-ASs.

check-first-as.description: Enable/disable checking the first AS in the AS_Path of the update messages from EBGP peers.

private-4byte-as.description: Enable/disable BGP private 4 byte AS. With BGP private-4-byte-as, BGP private as is from 64512 to 65535 and from 4200000000 to 4294967294.

peer-up-route-lowest-priority.description: Enable/disable reducing route priority to lowest.

memory-limit.description: Enable/disable using the prefix memory-limit command, you can configure the capability of BGP about memory limit when the system memory usage exceeded.
